metadata.TITLE: Catch Up On The Latest News Clips - ITVX
metadata.DESC: Discover the latest and breaking news clips from ITV. ITVX - The UK's freshest streaming service.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The latest ITV News headlines - as Holly Willoughby comments on Phillip Schofield's affair
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch a short summary of today's top stories from the ITV News team.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Passengers left frustrated by electronic passport gate failures at airports
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The government has said e-gates are now working after the problem at airports across the country, which meant long waits for those arriving into the UK.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: ITV did not find any evidence of Phillip Schofield relationship 'beyond hearsay and rumour'
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: ITV say they investigated rumours of a relationship between Phillip Schofield and an ITV employee which were denied by both parties in early 2020.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Body of 15-year-old boy found in the River Eden after major search operation
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: A group of teenage boys got into difficulty in the River Eden in Carlisle on Friday. One has now been confirmed dead with another in a critical condition.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Luton Town beat Coventry City in penalties to return to the Premier League after 31 years
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Luton's captain Tom Lockyer collapsed on the pitch before being taken to hospital. The club have since confirmed he is "responsive and talking" to his famlily.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Post Office apologises for using racial slur to describe staff caught up in miscarriage of justice
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: A spokesperson condemned the "abhorrent" language used in a document to classify black workers during the Horizon IT scandal.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Meet 'The Man With The Pram' who has raised a million pounds for charity
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: John Burkhill has become a famous face in Sheffield and he has made it his life's work to collect money for cancer charity Macmillan.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Boris Johnson denies breaking covid rules and brands claims 'nonsensical'
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The former Prime Minister has been referred to police by the Cabinet Office over alleged visits to Chequers and Downing Street while covid rules were in place.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Turkey prepares to vote again in most pivotal election for a generation
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: After neither of the major candidates reached the 50% vote threshold two weeks ago, Turkey returns to the ballot box for the first ever second round run-off.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Why a rare Indian steam train is going under the hammer in Oxfordshire
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: The steam train is the only one that exists outside of India and has been running on a very special railway around one family's home. It is now being sold off.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: The Rundown: ITV News' daily update for teenagers
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch a new edition of The Rundown every afternoon.

heroAndLatestData.episodeTitle: Sunny skies and feeling warm: The latest ITV Weather forecast
heroAndLatestData.synopsis: Watch the latest UK forecast from the ITV Weather team.

longformData.title: ITV News at Ten
longformData.description: The latest news from ITV News at Ten.

longformData.title: ITV Evening News
longformData.description: All the latest news from the ITV Evening News team

longformData.title: Good Morning Britain
longformData.description: BAFTA-nominated breakfast show covering the latest news, sport & weather

longformData.title: King Charles III: The Coronation
longformData.description: History in the making - relive the day in full

longformData.title: Tonight
longformData.description: Compelling current affairs stories that get to the heart of what matters

longformData.title: Peston
longformData.description: ITV News' Robert Peston presents his lively political interview programme

longformData.title: Procession to The Palace
longformData.description: Julie Etchingham and Tom Bradby present as the King and Queen depart Westminster Abbey.

longformData.title: The Coronation
longformData.description: Julie Etchingham and Tom Bradby present as the King and Queen arrive at Westminster Abbey.

longformData.title: The Build-Up
longformData.description: History in the making - join ITV for uninterrupted coverage.

longformData.title: 60 Minutes: Prince Harry Interview
longformData.description: Prince Harry sits down with Anderson Cooper from CBS' 60 Minutes

longformData.title: Highlights
longformData.description: A moment in history - watch highlights from an unforgettable day

clips.episodeTitle: Boris Johnson denies breaking covid rules and brands claims 'nonsensical'
clips.synopsis: The former Prime Minister has been referred to police by the Cabinet Office over alleged visits to Chequers and Downing Street while covid rules were in place.

clips.episodeTitle: Net migration figure reaches record-high of 606,000
clips.synopsis: The net migration figure of 606,000 is well above the target of 226,000 set in the Conservative Party's 2019 manifesto.

clips.episodeTitle: Covid inquiry chair demands Boris Johnson hand over WhatsApp messages
clips.synopsis: The Cabinet Office has been accused of not handing over Boris Johnson's Covid WhatsApp messages. The former PM says he has always complied with the inquiry.

clips.episodeTitle: Home Secretary to avoid ethics investigation over speeding ticket
clips.synopsis: The Prime Minister has said his independent ethics adviser has not recommended further investigation into Suella Braverman's handling of a speeding penalty.

clips.episodeTitle: Chancellor holds meeting with food bosses over rising costs of weekly shop
clips.synopsis: Jeremy Hunt met food manufacturers as the cost of groceries becomes the new epicentre of the cost of living crisis.

clips.episodeTitle: Dominic Raab to stand down as MP at next election
clips.synopsis: Mr Raab was forced to quit the Cabinet last month, after a lengthy investigation of bullying claims made against him by civil servants.

clips.episodeTitle: Junior doctors to hold fresh 72-hour strike in June over pay
clips.synopsis: Members of the BMA will walk out from 7am on June 14 after the Government failed to make what the union considered a “credible offer” on pay.

clips.episodeTitle: Starmer: 'NHS won't survive another five years of the Tory government'
clips.synopsis: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has given a speech today outlining what his party would do to address waiting lists, bring in reforms and train more NHS staff.

clips.episodeTitle: What would Labour do about housing if they won the next election?
clips.synopsis: Labour leader Sir Keir Starmer has been setting out his plans to 'fix the housing crisis' if they were in government, including building on green-belt land.

clips.episodeTitle: New raft of rental reforms with landlords banned from 'no-fault' evictions
clips.synopsis: The long-promised plans to abolish so-called 'no-fault evictions' have been introduced to Parliament under the Renters' Reform Bill.

clips.episodeTitle: Turkey prepares to vote again in most pivotal election for a generation
clips.synopsis: After neither of the major candidates reached the 50% vote threshold two weeks ago, Turkey returns to the ballot box for the first ever second round run-off.

clips.episodeTitle: 12 people taken to hospital after passenger opens plane's emergency exit door
clips.synopsis: 194 passengers were on board the flight which safely landed South Korea but the door was still open. One person has been detained.

clips.episodeTitle: FBI documents reveal U.S. plot to kill the late Queen
clips.synopsis: Newly-released secret documents reveal there was a potential assassination threat when the late Queen Elizabeth II visited the U.S. in 1983.

clips.episodeTitle: Senior advisor to Zelenskyy says counter-offensive against Russia has begun
clips.synopsis: It comes as the head of the private army fighting on behalf of Russia in Bakhmut is pulling out troops, as regular Russian forces take up their positions.

clips.episodeTitle: Tech trouble for Ron DeSantis as campaign launch hit by Twitter meltdown
clips.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of Twitter users joined the livestream event but were met with disruption, from glitches to "melting servers".

clips.episodeTitle: Watch the moment Sydney building crumbles during huge fire
clips.synopsis: More than 100 firefighters were sent to tackle the blaze in the heart of Sydney - although it wasn't immediately clear what started it.

clips.episodeTitle: Inside the hospitals treating Ukrainian military casualties from the battlefield
clips.synopsis: ITV News was invited to film in a field hospital treating casualties fighting in the area in and around Bakhmut.

clips.episodeTitle: Russian territory on Ukraine border comes under attack from militia group
clips.synopsis: A group of anti-Putin Russians has said they're behind an attack in the Belgorod region of Russia, close to the border with Ukraine.

clips.episodeTitle: Real Madrid lodge hate crime complaint after racial abuse of Vinicius Junior
clips.synopsis: Vinicius Junior has said Spain is now "known as a country of racists" following a match against Valencia when he was repeatedly targeted with abuse.

clips.episodeTitle: Saudi Arabia's first female astronaut on "dream come true" with space launch
clips.synopsis: Three paying customers have headed to the International Space Station on ten-day trip, including the first Arab woman to go into space.

clips.episodeTitle: John Cleese says phone hacking experience left him feeling 'slightly violated'
clips.synopsis: The Fawlty Towers star spoke to ITV News as he attended London's High Court, for the high profile hacking case against Mirror Group Newspapers.

clips.episodeTitle: Worrying levels of E. coli found inside some UK oysters
clips.synopsis: Exclusive research carried out by ITV News and Watershed Investigations found some shellfish areas have seven times the E. coli levels deemed safe for eating.

clips.episodeTitle: The chaos and confusion caused by the ever-expanding power of A.I
clips.synopsis: An ITV News documentary has been exploring the risks posed by artificial intelligence, such as its power to undermine democracy or impersonate individuals.

clips.episodeTitle: Fresh claims of misogyny and bullying behaviour within Metropolitan Police
clips.synopsis: A former detective within the Met has given an inside account of her time in the force. Jess McDonald’s book 'No Comment' is out on Thursday, May 25.

clips.episodeTitle: Bludgeoned from behind: Survivor of alleged Levi Bellfield attack speaks out
clips.synopsis: A woman who believes she was attacked by Millie Dowler's killer Levi Bellfield has told ITV News how police failed to tell her of his alleged confession.

clips.episodeTitle: Exclusive figures reveal a third of children being exposed to vape adverts online
clips.synopsis: The Advertising Standards Authority say they are increasingly concerned about e-cigarette promotions targeting young people online.

clips.episodeTitle: How a group of volunteer British doctors are helping to save lives in Syria
clips.synopsis: The doctors from the UK are training and supporting local medics still dealing with the aftermath of February's devastating earthquakes.

clips.episodeTitle: Cost of living crisis: Meet the unpaid carers living at breaking point
clips.synopsis: Carers are having to make their allowances go further as prices rise and there are more issues with recruitment, retention and providing respite care.

clips.episodeTitle: On Ukraine's frontline: The battle for Bakhmut where fighting rages every day
clips.synopsis: John Ray and the ITV News team report from Eastern Ukraine, where almost constant explosions and gunfire are obliterating the town of Bakhmut.

clips.episodeTitle: The people pushed to their limits by the cost of living crisis
clips.synopsis: Watch 'Life & Debt: Stories from the Edge', an ITV News documentary looking at the true impact the squeeze in living standards is having on people in the UK.

clips.episodeTitle: X marks the spot: The sacred Himalayan town slowly collapsing
clips.synopsis: As the sloped landscape slowly falls away beneath the feet of its inhabitants, the future of the pilgrim town of Joshimath is becoming increasingly dubious.

clips.episodeTitle: Children waiting years for mental health help as waiting lists spiral
clips.synopsis: Recent data, shared exclusively with ITV News, shows the shockingly long waiting times for tens of thousands of children needing treatment across the UK.

clips.episodeTitle: How will higher mortgage rates affect homeowners?
clips.synopsis: Nationwide has increased rates by up to 0.45 percentage points for any customers taking out a new deal - so how much more could one cost customers?

clips.episodeTitle: Net migration rises to new record high - so who is migrating here and why?
clips.synopsis: Official statistics show net migration to the UK rose to 606,000 in 2022, up from 488,000 in 2021. So why is the number rising?

clips.episodeTitle: Why are university students fighting for compensation in a High Court battle?
clips.synopsis: Thousands of students are unhappy over the disruption they faced to their education as a result of the pandemic while continuing to pay full tuition fees.

clips.episodeTitle: What are the key events in the disappearance of Madeleine McCann?
clips.synopsis: In the week police divers searched a dam in Portugal, we look back at the 16 year long investigation into the disappearance of three-year-old Madeleine McCann.

clips.episodeTitle: The top four scams to be on the lookout for
clips.synopsis: Online scams are on the rise - from suspicious links in emails, to adverts for investment opportunities on social media. Here's what to look out for.

clips.episodeTitle: What has the human and financial cost of climate change been?
clips.synopsis: New statistics show the extent of damage climate change is already causing. From floods in Italy to wildfires in Canada, we explain the results.

clips.episodeTitle: New renter rules: How could your rights change?
clips.synopsis: Laws improving the rights of renters are being presented to Parliament today - but what do they include and how will things change for tenants and landlords?

clips.episodeTitle: How women's football went from an outright ban to selling out Wembley
clips.synopsis: Sunday's FA Cup final is expected to break attendance records for women's football. So how has the game grown since the FA ban was lifted in the 1970s?

clips.episodeTitle: What are Prince Harry's court battles against newspapers all about?
clips.synopsis: The Duke of Sussex has several legal claims against different media outlets going on - here's what you need to know about them.
